definition: you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
(negative prefix)/not/no

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: Various deceptive means are hardly preventable.
sentences.chinese: 各種各樣的忽悠手段是防不勝防的。

sentences.english: Site send patrols every night, but the thief is still very hard to detect.
sentences.chinese: 工地每天晚上都派人巡邏，但是小偷還是防不勝防。

sentences.english: Road section collapses into 5-meter long hole .
sentences.chinese: 上海突現路面塌陷“坑”來橫禍防不勝防。

sentences.english: The problem, however, is that enumeration can be arbitrarily complex.
sentences.chinese: 然而問題在於這種枚舉的複雜性防不勝防。

sentences.english: A valiant attempt to defend her babies does not deter these assailants.
sentences.chinese: 雖然它極力保護孩子，襲擊者依舊防不勝防。

sentences.english: Critics say the risk of a potentially toxic food supply is untenable.
sentences.chinese: 批評者則說，食物供給可能有毒的風險防不勝防。

definition: many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
a common occurrence (idiom)
to deceive/to conceal
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
dangerous/ruthless/treacherous
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to boast
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
bitter/harsh/grim/ruthless/severe/cut-throat (competition)
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
hard to distinguish real from imitation
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
